items.title: Annapurna's 2025 lineup of indie games is full of tea and T-poses
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Annapurna Interactive hosted its first showcase of the year following the mass resignation of its staff.
- The showcase introduced several indie games set to be released in 2025, including:
  - **To a T** by Keita Takahashi, launching on May 28th, 2025.
  - **Morsels**, a creature collector roguelite, with a 2025 release date yet to be confirmed.
  - **Wheel World**, an open-world cycling adventure, set for summer 2025.
  - **Faraway**, featuring a shooting star in a procedurally generated story mode, releasing later this year.
  - **Lushfoil Photography Sim**, launching on April 15th, 2025, featuring true-to-life photography.
  - **Wanderstop**, a tea-themed cozy adventure sim, set to launch on March 11th.
  - **Skin Deep**, a comedic action game, launching on April 30th.
  - **Sayonara Wild Hearts**, now available on PS5 with new updates and game mode.
- Each game showcased unique themes and gameplay mechanics, appealing to various player interests.

items.title: Google Drive gets searchable video transcripts
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Google introduces searchable video transcripts in Google Drive.
- Feature starts rolling out today, expected to complete by March 26, 2025.
- Transcripts appear as timestamped text blocks next to the video, highlighting spoken text in real-time.
- Users can click text in transcripts to navigate to specific moments in videos.
- Transcript availability requires existing captions, which can be auto-generated if not present.

items.title: Anthropic’s new ‘hybrid reasoning’ AI model is its smartest yet
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Anthropic has released Claude 3.7 Sonnet, its first hybrid reasoning AI model, enhancing capabilities in math and coding.
- The model is accessible via the Claude app, Anthropic's API, Amazon Bedrock, and Google Cloud’s Vertex AI, costing $3 per million input tokens.
- Claude Code, an agentic coding tool, can edit files, write tests, and integrate with GitHub, enhancing developer collaboration.
- Claude 3.7 demonstrates improved performance in coding, finance, and legal tasks, with a knowledge cut-off of October 2024.
- Developers can influence Claude's responsiveness through a scratchpad, setting specific response times.
- Internal applications include front-end designs and interactive games, with Claude successfully navigating challenges in a Pokémon game.
- The industry trend points towards unified AI models that integrate reasoning with other functionalities.

items.title: All the smart home news, reviews, and gadgets you need to know about
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The smart home offers convenience, safety, energy efficiency, and fun.
- However, it can be complicated and hard to keep up with rapid developments in the industry.
- The article will provide the latest smart home reviews, guides, and news from major companies like Apple, Amazon, Samsung, and Google.
- New technologies such as Matter, Thread, and UWB will be covered along with existing products.
- Skylight has raised its subscription price from $39 to $79 for its Calendar Max device after enhancing features.
- The Ring Outdoor Cam Plus is now available for preorder with 2K video capabilities at $99.99, expected to ship on March 26th, 2025.
- Eufy introduced the FamiLock S3 Max, a $399 smart lock that uses palm vein recognition to unlock.
- Apple is reportedly developing a home robot that may resemble a lamp and focus more on user interaction than physical appearance.

items.title: Elizabeth Holmes Sentenced to 11 Years in Prison for Theranos Fraud
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elizabeth Holmes has been sentenced to 11 years and 3 months in prison for defrauding investors in Theranos.
- Holmes' sentence was later reduced to 9 years and 7 months due to behavioral considerations.
- She must serve 85% of her sentence regardless of good conduct.
- Holmes will have a supervised release period of 3 years after serving her sentence.
- The sentencing judge, Edward Davila, noted that Holmes' refusal to accept responsibility for her actions influenced the sentence.

items.title: Andor is on the offensive in latest season 2 trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Disney Plus will release **Andor** season 2 episodes as four weekly chapters starting **April 22, 2025**.
- The new trailer showcases Cassian's adventures, hinting at increased stakes in the final season.
- Creator Tony Gilroy emphasized the scale of the story and the variety of characters, promising a deeper experience.

items.title: Ember’s high-tech smart mug has fallen to its lowest price to date
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The Ember Mug 2 is now available at a discounted price of $89.99, $60 off its original price.
- The mug maintains beverages at a desired temperature between 125°F and 145°F and lasts up to 80 minutes on a charge.
- It can be operated indefinitely when placed on its charging coaster and features app connectivity for temperature control.
- The mug is rated IPX7, making it safe to wash in water, but it is not dishwasher safe.

items.title: Balatro’s PEGI 18 rating in Europe has been changed following appeal
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Balatro, a roguelike game, has changed its PEGI rating from 18 to 12 following an appeal by its publisher.
- The original PEGI 18 rating was due to prominent gambling imagery, despite no actual gambling in the game.
- The PEGI Complaints Board acknowledged that fantastical elements in the game justified the new PEGI 12 rating.
- PEGI is also revising classification criteria for games with gambling imagery to provide better age ratings.
- Playstack, the game’s publisher, welcomed the decision and praised PEGI's commitment to improving classification standards.

items.title: Google is replacing Gmail’s SMS authentication with QR codes
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Google is replacing SMS-based six-digit authentication codes for Gmail with QR codes.
- The change aims to reduce global SMS abuse and enhance security during login.
- QR codes will eliminate risks associated with SMS, including SIM swapping and the potential for phishing.

items.title: Conservative podcaster Dan Bongino named deputy FBI director
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Dan Bongino has been appointed as the FBI's new deputy director by President Donald Trump.
- Bongino has experience as a New York police officer and US Secret Service agent, but lacks FBI experience.
- He is known in conservative media for hosting a Fox News show and contributing to InfoWars.
- Bongino's online influence includes being labeled a top election conspiracy "misinformation superspreader" by global human rights group Avaaz.
- He will serve under FBI director Kash Patel, who aims to "rebuild" the agency after his confirmation by the Senate. Bongino's appointment does not require Senate confirmation.

items.title: Apple designer Susan Kare made 32 new, Mac-inspired physical icons
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Susan Kare released 32 new icons as part of the "Esc Keys" collection in collaboration with Asprey Studio.
- The collection includes mechanical keyboard keycaps and wearable pendants featuring 8-bit pixel art illustrations.
- Prices range from $650 for silver keys to $2,064 for gold vermeil pendants, each accompanied by blockchain-inscribed digital artwork.

items.title: Five ways to send a message to your representatives
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Article discusses how to effectively contact government representatives through various methods.
- Highlights the importance of voicing opinions on issues via social media, texts, emails, or phone calls.
- Provides resources such as [USA.gov](https://www.usa.gov/) to find representatives and their contact information.
- Mentions [Congress.gov](https://www.congress.gov/) for tracking legislative bills and their progress through Congress.
- Introduces [GovTrack.us](https://www.govtrack.us/) for tracking congressional activities and recent votes.
- Details the [5 Calls](https://www.5calls.org/) app that provides scripts for contacting representatives about current issues.
- Explains how [Resist.bot](https://resistbot.io/) can turn texts into faxes or emails to representatives.

items.title: Vimeo CEO Philip Moyer is betting on the human touch — and AI
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Vimeo, under CEO Philip Moyer, is shifting focus from a public video platform to a private, human-centered video distribution service.
- Moyer's background includes senior positions at Amazon, Google, and Microsoft, providing him insight into tech and business strategies.
- AI's role in content creation is explored, raising questions about monetization in an oversaturated video market.
- Vimeo aims to become the largest private video distribution platform catering to entities desiring privacy over algorithm-driven public sharing.
- Key customers include schools and medical professionals seeking to share content without data collection or advertising interruptions.

items.title: Monster Hunter Wilds thrives on spectacle
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary: - Monster Hunter Wilds features battles against enormous monsters in diverse environments, emphasizing a spectacle-driven gameplay experience. - The game continues the open-world format established in Monster Hunter World, keeping the core mechanics while introducing new elements and more cinematic battles. - Set in the Forbidden Lands, players follow a storyline involving a decimated village and a creature called The White Wraith, alongside deeper monster-targeting mechanics and a second weapon type for mounts. - Wilds is recognized as the most accessible entry in the series, with seamless area transitions, despite some rigid menu challenges during gameplay. - The game launches on February 28th on PC, PS5, and Xbox, continuing the thrilling hunt experience the series is known for.

items.title: Sigma’s BF is a minimalist full-frame camera with no memory card slot
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Sigma announced the compact 24.6-megapixel full-frame camera called the BF with a minimalist design.
- The camera features four button controls, a 3.2-inch touchscreen, and a dial for menu navigation.
- It replaces a memory card slot with a built-in 230GB SSD, capable of storing 14,000 JPEGs or 4,300 uncompressed RAW files.
- Expected to ship in April 2025, it will retail for $1,999, excluding lens.
- Compatible with L-Mount lenses, with Sigma updating its I Series collection with a new silver color option.
- Includes 13 color modes and can capture 6K video at up to 29.97 fps, with a maximum of 2.5 hours of video storage at highest quality.

items.title: How to set up crash detection on your Android phone
items.author: David Nield
items.summary:
- Crash detection feature utilizes movement sensors to detect driving and sudden stops.
- Available on Pixel phones starting with the Google Pixel 4A and compatible with Pixel Watch 2 and 3.
- If a crash is detected, the phone and watch will sound an alarm and inquire about the status, with options to cancel or notify emergency services.
- Automatic alerts are sent out if there is no response after 60 seconds.
- Instructions for enabling crash detection on Pixel phones include using the Personal Safety app and setting up emergency contacts.
- For Pixel Watches, feature status syncs across devices, and can be managed via the Pixel Watch app or directly on the watch.

items.title: Apple’s iPhone 17 lineup is looking a little Pixelated
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The iPhone 17 Pro, Pro Max, and Air models may feature a wider, pill-shaped rear camera similar to Google’s Pixel 9.
- CAD renders show the camera bars on the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max extending across the upper body, with rounder edges.
- The standard iPhone 17 model's camera module remains largely unchanged compared to premium models.
- Leaker Majin Bu presented the designs, which align with previous leaks about the iPhone 17 series.
- Official design details won't be confirmed until Apple's announcement in September 2025.

items.title: What’s the deal with all these airplane crashes?
items.author: Darryl Campbell
items.summary:
- Four commercial jet crashes occurred within ten weeks: 1) Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 8243 on Christmas Day, 2) Jeju Air Flight 7C2216 on December 29, 3) American Airlines Flight 5342 on January 29, and 4) Delta Connection Flight 4819 on February 17.
- The NTSB reports 13 fatal airplane crashes in the U.S. since the start of the year, covering both private and commercial flights.
- The FAA announced layoffs of around 400 employees, impacting critical roles such as mechanics and flight safety specialists.
- Aviation safety has improved over the years, with only a small risk of accidents; statistically, chances of a fatal crash remain about 1 in 2 million.
- Despite recent crashes, airline safety systems remain under strain due to staffing shortages and outdated infrastructure, particularly in air traffic control.

items.title: Apple responds to tariff threat with a $500 billion US investment
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
* Apple plans to invest over $500 billion in the US over the next four years, creating 20,000 new jobs and opening a new server factory in Texas.
* The announcement follows a meeting between Tim Cook and President Trump amid threats of tariffs on Chinese imports.
* The new Houston factory, set to open next year, will produce servers for Apple’s AI features and generate thousands of jobs.
* Apple is doubling its Advanced Manufacturing Fund from $5 billion to $10 billion to support US manufacturing.
* The company will also establish an Apple Manufacturing Academy in Detroit to aid local businesses and provide training.
* This investment follows a previous commitment of $430 billion over five years announced in 2021, which included a 3,000-employee campus in North Carolina, currently on pause.

items.title: Grok blocked results saying Musk and Trump “spread misinformation”
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Grok, Elon Musk's ChatGPT competitor, was updated to block results mentioning misinformation related to Musk and Trump.
- The change was made by an unspecified ex-OpenAI employee at xAI without proper approval.
- xAI's head of engineering, Igor Babuschkin, stated that the system prompt is publicly visible for user transparency.
- Grok's internal rules and the incident raised questions about the integrity and aims of the AI.
- Musk describes Grok as a “maximally truth-seeking” AI, yet the system has been limited in its responses regarding certain individuals.
- Grok's recent interactions indicate it has referred to Musk and Trump as harmful figures in America.

items.title: The Space Force shares a photo of Earth taken by the X-37B space plane
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- The Space Force released a photo taken by the X-37B space plane during its aerobraking maneuvers.
- The photo was captured last year while the plane was high above the Earth.
- This mission marks the seventh for the X-37B, with the previous mission lasting about two-and-a-half years.

items.title: Elon Musk claims federal employees have 48 hours to explain recent work or resign
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Elon Musk tweeted that federal employees will receive an email regarding their recent work productivity.
- The email from the Office of Personnel Management has a response deadline of 11:59 PM ET on Monday.
- Musk stated that failing to respond could be interpreted as resignation, a claim lawyers say is illegal.
- House minority leader Hakeem Jeffries criticized Musk's demands, stating he has no authority over federal employees.
- Various departments instructed workers to await guidance, while unions advised against responding to the email.

items.title: Hades II just keeps getting better
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Hades II has received its second major update in early access.
- New regions with enemies, characters, and music have been added with each update.
- Players can now fight against a new miniboss and experience visual redesigns of game elements.
- The update adds a sixth weapon and significant gameplay changes based on community feedback.
- Supergiant Games is focusing on enhancing gameplay experience over rushing to complete the game.

items.title: Apple’s M4 MacBook Air bump may be just around the corner
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple is set to update the 13-inch and 15-inch MacBook Airs in March 2025, as reported by Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman.
- The updates will include a transition to M4 chips, completing the MacBook line's M4 transition.
- Both models are expected to launch simultaneously, with preparations already underway in marketing and retail.
- M4 MacBook Airs are anticipated to share specs with the low-end MacBook Pro, featuring upgrades such as supporting two external displays.
- The M4 updates for Mac Studio and Mac Pro are expected between March and June and from June to fall, respectively.

items.title: Our Favorite Apps for Listening to Music
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Discussion on popular music streaming services: Spotify leads, followed by Apple Music.
- Users express dissatisfaction with YouTube Music despite it being free.
- Tidal garners positive feedback for audio quality and being music-focused.
- For purchasing music, Bandcamp and Discogs are favored.
- Recommendations for music management apps include Plexamp and Roon.
- Many users are interested in rebuilding personal music collections.

items.title: The iOS 18.4 beta brings Matter robot vacuum support
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Apple released the first developer beta of iOS 18.4, supporting robot vacuums in the Apple Home app through Matter.
- Functionality confirmed using a Switchbot S10, which first added Matter support last year but required a hub.
- New features include a Home widget showing controls for the robot vacuum, such as start/stop and cleaning modes, plus automation options for robot vacuums in scenes.
- Previous expectations for Matter support in robot vacuums last year did not materialize, and few companies currently offer it.

items.title: The Long Wait for a Glimpse of Luigi
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Hundreds gathered for the Luigi Mangione pre-trial hearing, creating a chaotic atmosphere.
- Mangione is accused of murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson and has not appeared publicly since before Christmas.
- His legal team reported significant public fundraising momentum, raising over half a million dollars for his defense.
- The hearing served as a procedural update with over 800 GB of evidence submitted by the prosecution.
- Mangione entered the courtroom in shackles, surrounded by officers, but reactions were muted with no dramatic gasps.
- The event has fueled public fascination and a following for Mangione, including notable supporters like Chelsea Manning.

items.title: The best smartphone you can buy for under $500
Spotify HiFi was announced four years ago, and it’s almost here — maybe
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Spotify HiFi, announced on February 22, 2021, is expected to launch as part of a Music Pro package in 2025 after extensive delays.
- Original plans to roll out the feature in 2021 were derailed by competitors like Apple Music and Amazon Music introducing similar features without added costs.
- The new Music Pro package may include features beyond audio quality, such as early-access concert ticketing and DJ remixing tools, with a possible price increase of $5 or $6 over the standard Premium subscription.

items.title: AT&T will let you split your bill with people on your plan
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- AT&T has introduced a new payment option called [SplitPay](https://about.att.com/blogs/2025/splitpay.html) that allows users to split their phone plan payment line-by-line.
- Available for select postpaid wireless plans, it allows users to still receive multi-line discounts.
- Account holders remain responsible for the total bill, and late payments can result in extra fees.
- Each payer will receive a payment link and amount owed at the beginning of the billing cycle.
- To set up SplitPay, users can visit [AT&T’s SplitPay page](https://m.att.com/myatt/native/deepLink.html?action=EnrollSplitPay&appInstall=N&handoffType=DSS&source=IYPO000000000000U&wtExtndSource=Ref-KM0098839) and select individual lines and devices to assign payments to.

items.title: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now
ASUS is making a ‘Fragrance Mouse,’ and it’s coming to the US
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- ASUS announced a "Fragrance Mouse" that complements its ASUS Aidol 14 Air Fragrance Edition laptop.
- The mouse features a refillable compartment for essential oils and connects via Bluetooth or a wireless dongle.
- It is expected to launch in the US around late April to early May, with no confirmed pricing yet.

items.title: Lost Records: Bloom & Rage blends its teen drama with a heavy dose of ’90s nostalgia
items.author: Khee Hoon Chan
items.summary:
- The game *Lost Records: Bloom & Rage* emphasizes ’90s nostalgia with a storyline about four teenagers.  
- Set in the small town of Velvet Cove, the game alternates between the present and the summer of ’95.  
- Features dialogue choices and interactions with objects to enhance the storytelling experience.  
- Focuses on the protagonist Swann's journey of friendship, social anxiety, and self-discovery through documenting her life with a camcorder.  
- The narrative explores complex characters and relationships, with a dramatic cliffhanger leading to a second release expected in mid-April.

items.title: Lenovo Legion Go S review: feels good, plays bad
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Lenovo Legion Go S is priced at $730 and aims to compete with the Steam Deck but falls short in performance.
- It features good ergonomics, a variable refresh rate screen, fast charging, but is hindered by low performance and a bloated Windows OS.
- Extensive benchmarks show the Z2 Go chip struggles against the Steam Deck OLED, often delivering lower frame rates despite higher wattage.
- Using the Bazzite OS showed improvements in framerate but still couldn't reach Steam Deck performance levels efficiently.
- Recommendations lean towards purchasing the Steam Deck over the Legion Go S, especially at its price point.

items.title: Die in the Dungeon will keep you busy until Slay the Spire 2
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Die in the Dungeon is a new roguelike deckbuilder inspired by Slay the Spire but incorporates dice-based gameplay.
- Players collect and play dice instead of cards, strategizing based on visible enemy moves.
- The game features attack, block, healing, and boosting dice, all requiring energy to use, adding to the strategic depth.
- Battles can take longer compared to Slay the Spire, with runs averaging nearly two hours.
- The game is currently in early access, with ongoing updates and a promising development roadmap.

items.title: Nvidia confirms ‘rare’ RTX 5090 and 5070 Ti manufacturing issue
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia has confirmed a manufacturing issue affecting less than 0.5% of RTX 5090, 5090D, and 5070 Ti GPUs, which are missing one render output unit (ROP).
- The average performance impact is reported at 4%, with no effect on AI or compute tasks.
- Affected consumers can obtain replacements from their board manufacturers; the production issue has been resolved.
- Multiple manufacturers like Zotac, MSI, Gigabyte, Manli, and Nvidia Founders Edition are impacted, and users are advised to check their GPUs using GPU-Z.

items.title: Reddit is experiencing outages again
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Reddit is facing ongoing outages following issues from the previous day.
- Users report that Reddit does not load on desktop browsers but works in incognito mode and on mobile devices when logged out.
- As of 7:58 PM ET, Reddit's status page acknowledged elevated levels of errors and stated they are investigating the issues.
- Downdetector recorded around 80,000 outage reports starting at approximately 7:30 PM ET.
- The company has not yet commented on the situation, following reports of international outages yesterday.

items.title: The Best Robot Vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums have become essential devices for cleaning floors efficiently.
- Prices have dropped significantly, making advanced models more accessible.
- The Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is highlighted as the best robot vacuum, featuring superior obstacle avoidance and cleaning performance.
- Innovations include hands-free docks, automated mopping, and advanced AI for navigation.
- Key features to consider are suction power, brush design, bin capacity, and mapping technology.

items.title: Elon Musk’s AI said he and Trump deserve the death penalty
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- xAI's Grok AI chatbot suggested that Donald Trump and Elon Musk deserve the death penalty, prompting an investigation by xAI.
- The chatbot provided these responses based on user queries; first naming Jeffrey Epstein, then Trump, and lastly Musk when prompted differently.
- xAI has since patched Grok to prevent it from suggesting who deserves capital punishment, now responding that it is not allowed to make that choice.

items.title: Grok resets the AI race
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's Grok-3 has emerged as a leader in the AI race, topping both the Chatbot Arena leaderboard and the App Store.
- Musk plans to introduce ChatGPT-like features and is exploring AI gaming, aiming to surpass OpenAI's ChatGPT.
- OpenAI recently reported 400 million weekly active users for ChatGPT, increasing competition in the AI landscape.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s Grok-3 AI model leads the Chatbot Arena leaderboard and tops the App Store.
- OpenAI releases GPT-4o, enhancing its ChatGPT model with faster performance.
- Google’s Gemini AI faces criticism for generating racially diverse Nazi content.
- Meta launches Project Waterworth, a major subsea cable initiative to support AI infrastructure globally.
- Google Meet integrates AI for automatic meeting summaries, creating actionable items with due dates.
- Amazon delays the launch of its revamped Alexa due to accuracy issues, now expected in March at the earliest.
- Thomson Reuters wins a court case against Ross Intelligence over copyright infringement relating to AI technology.
- AI chatbots criticized for distorting news representations, according to a BBC study.

items.title: Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and more: all the news about the handheld PC gaming revolution
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Valve’s master plan for Steam Machines becomes clearer as handheld PCs gain traction.
- Asus ROG Ally X is acclaimed as the best Windows gaming handheld available.
- MSI's Claw handheld criticized for performance issues.
- Lenovo Legion Go receives positive reviews for its versatility as a handheld device.
- Steam Deck's initial limitations addressed; it is now considered a viable gaming option.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's **Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE)** is causing panic, with implications for mass unemployment and social programs.
- President Trump met with **Tim Cook**, stating Apple is investing hundreds of billions in the US.
- The **General Services Administration (GSA)** will shut down all federal EV chargers, citing lack of mission criticality.
- **Coinbase** announced that the SEC will drop its enforcement case against it, with no fines and no business changes.
- Trump plans to **eliminate the Office of Community Planning and Development**, raising concerns over disaster recovery efforts.
- Musk's appearance at **CPAC** was characterized as strange and incoherent but received positive reactions from the audience.

items.title: Elon Musk’s first month of destroying America will cost us decades
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- The establishment of Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) is disrupting the government, leading to mass unemployment and defunding of social programs.
- Over 10,000 federal workers have been fired, many of whom were military veterans, with 75,000 accepting buyouts.
- There is a significant impact on the economy with frozen government grants affecting farmers and rural communities, risking bankruptcies.
- Foreign trading partners are reacting negatively to U.S. policies, with potential import blocks on key agricultural products.
- Cuts to federal funding also threaten scientific research and healthcare services, resulting in worse patient care across the U.S.
- Careless firings at the Department of Agriculture could jeopardize public health and response to epidemics like bird flu.
- The chaotic restructuring of government services threatens the basic functions relying on expert knowledge and operational governance.
- The political landscape is turbulent, with potential conflicts between Musk's ambitions and Trump's power.

items.title: The first iOS 18.4 developer beta is here, with support for Priority Notifications
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Apple has released the first developer beta for iOS 18.4 and other platforms, including macOS and iPadOS.
- The beta introduces support for **Priority Notifications**, an Apple Intelligence feature that categorizes important notifications.
- Priority Notifications is off by default but can be enabled via settings.
- Details on an upgraded **Siri** remain undisclosed, with reports of delays in its development.
- iOS 18.4 will allow users to set default translation apps and enable EU users to change default navigation apps.
- The beta also previews a **new app for Vision Pro** owners and a redesigned Mail app for Macs and iPads.
- A new **Apple News Plus Food section** will be introduced with thousands of recipes.

items.title: Apple's AI Developments: iOS 18, macOS Sequoia, and Future Updates
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Apple releases iOS 18.2, integrating AI tools and ChatGPT features.
- Vision Pro’s ultrawide display marks a significant application for the Mac.
- iOS 18 enhances notification features, including chat integrations and homepage customizations.
- Apple Intelligence set for broader language support starting April, adding French and Spanish among others.
- Collaboration with Alibaba for AI functionalities in China reportedly underway.
- Users report issues with Apple Intelligence being re-enabled after software updates.
- Updates to iOS address critical security vulnerabilities, patching exploits that could breach device security.

items.title: How the EU’s DMA is changing Big Tech: all of the news and updates
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA) implements new rules affecting major tech companies like Apple and Google.
- Apple plans to enable sideloading and alternative app stores for iPhone users.
- Google is adjusting its services like Search and Chrome to comply with the DMA, affecting visibility and user experience in certain regions.
- Both Apple and Google are facing scrutiny over practices deemed anti-competitive under the new regulations.
- The DMA aims to foster competition and improve consumer options in the digital market.

items.title: Federal workers launch a new site to share inside information about DOGE
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- A new website called [We the Builders](https://www.wethebuilders.org/) launched by federal workers to share anonymous stories about the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- The site aims to inform the public about the effects of DOGE on federal agencies and citizens.
- Current and former federal workers can share experiences without fear of retribution, with a focus on maintaining security and anonymity for contributors.

items.title: Apple’s News app is getting a recipes section
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple is introducing a recipes section in its News app for News Plus subscribers.  
- The new Apple News Plus Food section will be part of iOS 18.4 and iPadOS 18.4, launching in April.  
- It will include tens of thousands of recipes from top publishers like Allrecipes and Bon Appétit.  
- Features include a well-designed recipe format and a new cook mode for full-screen instructions.  
- Select stories and recipes will also be available for non-Plus subscribers.  
- This addition intensifies competition with The New York Times' app.

items.title: South of Midnight’s Southern Gothic folklore world is rooted in authenticity
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - The game follows protagonist Hazel as she searches for her mother in a hurricane-destroyed swamp. - Hazel learns her powers as a Weaver, drawing on Southern Gothic folklore. - Compulsion Games focused on authenticity through research and expert consultation in Southern traditions. - Music features contributions from a Nashville gospel children’s choir. - Director Ahmed Best emphasizes the importance of African American voices in the game's narrative and performance. - The game's storytelling is rooted in expertise rather than generalization. - South of Midnight is set to launch on April 8th on Xbox, Game Pass, and PC.
